Notes: Column A is an arbitrary index number (or text label) of the point to be processed
Column B is the depth at that point (cm)
Column C is the velocity at that point (cm/s)
Column D is arbitrary numeric or text label for each transect. It can represent the longitudinal position of the transect, but it doesn't have to, because that information isn't used here.
Column E is the position (in meters) of a the point this row represents along its transect. First and last points will be interpreted as the edges of the river and can have 0 depth/velocity.
Column F is bed roughness height (cm) for a log velocity profile
Column G is fork length (cm); is ignored unless mass is also specified
Column H is mass (g); is ignored unless fork length is also specified
Column I is for temperature in degrees C
Column J is turbidity in NTU
Column K is the address for the drift density CSV file
Columns F-K are optional, but don't delete the columns or their headers; just leave the cells blank if you don't want to specify them
If you leave an optional column blank, it will default to the values specified on the Model Settings tab
Weird transect 4 is meant a a test of the transect modeling mechanism, set up such that the interpolated
depths and velocities in the middle of the transect (PositionOnTransect=20) should be
uniform at 25 each. This allows comparison of results from that mechanism with results from
a conventional model run at depth=25 and velocity=25. Batch method 1 point labeled 21 has
these depths and velocities for comparison.
